docs.lead_paragraph: Chris McCarron is a Hall of Fame jockey and the founder and lead instructor of the North American Racing Academy in Lexington, Ky.
docs.abstract: Chris McCarron, a jockey for 28 years, argues that ending the use of race-day medication would benefit horses, jockeys and thoroughbred racing itself.
docs.snippet: Chris McCarron, a jockey for 28 years, argues that ending the use of race-day medication would benefit horses, jockeys and thoroughbred racing itself.

docs.lead_paragraph: Just when you thought that serotonin was passé, and you'd tossed all your half-used bottles of S.S.R.I.-type antidepressants because the ones that didn't give you nausea or smother your libido left you wondering whether you were in the placebo arm of a clinical trial, here comes a raft of new discoveries that sweeps the small, evolutionarily ancient and slyly powerful signaling molecule back on to center stage. Researchers lately have learned that serotonin plays an impressive number of critical roles throughout the body, both below the neck and above it, and from the earliest days of prenatal pre-sentience. One team has found that serotonin starts seeping into the embryonic forebrain during the first trimester of pregnancy, helping to shape the basic neural circuitry that later in life will be applied to learning, emoting and consulting a psychiatrist.

headline.main: Job Description Grows For Our Utility Hormone

docs.abstract: Study in journal Nature finds that the utility hormone seratonin performs impressive number of roles throughout the human body; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: Just when you thought that serotonin was passé, and you'd tossed all your half-used bottles of S.S.R.I.-type antidepressants because the ones that didn't give you nausea or smother your libido left you wondering whether you were in the placebo arm...

headline.main: Helping New Drugs Out of Research’s ‘Valley of Death’

docs.abstract: A broken system lets promising research on new drugs languish, but a group devoted to fighting MS is working to fix it.
docs.snippet: A broken system lets promising research on new drugs languish, but a group devoted to fighting MS is working to fix it.
